ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the quality of the class materials for Behavioral & Inst Economics?
Compared to other YLS classes, how much out-of-class preparation, reading, and writing does Behavioral & Inst Economics require?
How would you rate the professor(s)'s management of class discussions?
Overall, how would you rate the professor(s)'s responsiveness to student comments, questions and concerns?
How would you rate the professor(s)'s availability to students outside of class?
Compared to other YLS classes, how valuable was in-class time in Behavioral & Inst Economics?
In your opinion, compared to other YLS professors you've had, how good a teacher was the professor(s)?
Would you recommend Behavioral & Inst Economics to other students?

narratives.question_text: Comments.If you wrote a paper with any of these professors, if the course was taught by more than one professor, or you would like to comment on any aspects previously mentioned
comments: Best decision ever for my 3L spring. I probably would never have watched 75% of these films if it weren't for this class, and I'm glad I did. Knowing you're going to have to write a response paper for each one also helps you to pay more attention and engage with the film than you might otherwise. The films and the (brief) discussions afterwards were thought-provoking.

I enjoyed Capitalism Film. I do wish that the videos were streamed however or that Professor Priest would tell students in advance how long a film would last so that they could plan accordingly. I also think instead of having to do 13 responses in order to get full credit ,there should be a range of 11-13 especially given that we had to be flexible when the professor had to cancel classes.
The weekly paper requirement was very open-ended and allowed me to write on any topic related to the movie which was great! I didn't feel pressured to take a certain view on capitalism.

The course is aptly named. It is a simple evaluation of films as they relate to capitalism and larger market forces. Professor Priest is a fantastic person, and he is quite enthusiastic about this course. Sure--the course is rather easy. However, you do have to contemplate for the page-and-a-half long papers that are due for each film.I certainly recommend taking this if you are looking for an enjoyable course or would like my exposure to Professor Priest.
